newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Bodies of teenage girls found-Belgian prosecutor.
newsitem.headline: Bodies of teenage girls found-Belgian prosecutor.

text.p: Belgian police have found and identified the bodies of teenagers An Marchal and Eefje Lambrecks, who were the subject of a Europe-wide alarm over paedophile abductors, Public Prosecutor Michel Bourlet told Belga news agency on Tuesday.

"The human remains discovered on Tuesday afternoon at Jumet (a suburb of the Belgian town of Charleroi) have been identified as those of An Marchal and Eefje Lambrecks, Public Prosecutor Michel Bourlet announced officially on Tuesday evening," Belga reported.
The cause and date of death were not immediately known.

Convicted child rapist Marc Dutroux, the key suspect in the paedophile abduction, sex and murder that has sent shockwaves across Europe, admitted kidnapping the two girls on August 22 last year in the Belgian port of Ostend.

Police found the bodies under a shed in the garden of a house owned by Dutroux in Jumet. It was formerly occupied by Frenchman Bernard Weinstein, an accomplice who Dutroux admits murdering and who he blames for killing the two teenagers.
